attributes.action: stop the Royal Mail from going on strike.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As the Royal Mail is the only company allowed or capable of offering a door-to-door (collection from the post box to your door step) service, the government should ban their workers from striking or let their competitors do the work that they refuse to.

We should also consider adopting this policy with the Emergency Services and any other sector where an essential public service is provided and their is no other company/organisation able to fill the gap.

The Armed Forces aren't allowed to strike, why should workers of other public services be allowed to?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
